background: A family wants to invest its total budget into two types of real estate: apartments and townhouses.
constraints: Money invested in both apartments and townhouses must be non-negative
Total investment in apartments and townhouses must not exceed TotalInvestment
Investment in apartments must not exceed MaxApartments
Investment in apartments must be at least MinInvestmentRatio times the investment in townhouses
objective: Maximize the total profit from investing in apartments and townhouses, with profit rates of ProfitRateApts and ProfitRateTH respectively
description: My family has decided to invest in real estate for the first time. Currently, they have \var{TotalInvestment} to invest, some in apartments and the rest in townhouses. The money invested in apartments must not be greater than \var{MaxApartments}. They have decided that the money invested in apartments must be at least \var{MinInvestmentRatio} as much as that in townhouses. If the apartments earn \var{ProfitRateApts}, and the townhouses earn \var{ProfitRateTH}, how much money should they invest in each to maximize profit?

parameters.definition: Maximum amount that can be invested in apartments
Minimum ratio of the money invested in apartments to that in townhouses
